- Shloka text: "रावणानन्तरोभ्राताममज्येष्ठश्चवीर्यवान् । कुम्भकर्णोमहातेजाश्शक्रप्रतिबलोयुधि ।।6.19.10।।"
- Judgment: SUPPORTED - The shloka confirms Kumbhakarna's valor, prowess, and equality to Indra in strength.

- Claim: "The text describes him as going into battle accompanied by troops of Rakshasas, capable of shaking the earth with his strides"
- Citation: [Yuddha Kanda 62.5]
- Shloka text: "भ्रातुस्सभवनंगच्छन्रक्षोगणसमन्विम् । कुम्भकर्णःपदन्यासैरकम्पयतमेदिनीम् ।।6.62.5।।"
- Judgment: SUPPORTED - The shloka explicitly mentions Kumbhakarna being accompanied by Rakshasas and shaking the earth with his strides.

- Citation: [Yuddha Kanda 65.33]

- Judgment: SUPPORTED - The shloka describes Kumbhakarna disregarding Lakshmana and attacking Rama, which supports the claim he continues to fight even when disregarded. Loyalty is inferred.
